 14690                                  
 14691                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14692                                  ;try_3:
 14693                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 14694                                  
 14695                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14696                                  
 14697                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14698                                  
 14699                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14700                                  ;
 14701                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14702                                  ;
 14703                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14704                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14705                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14706                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14707                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14708                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14709                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14710                                  ;
 14711                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14712                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14713                                  ;
 14714                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14715                                  
 14716                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14717                                  HMAPtr:
 14718 0000140F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14719                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14720 00001414 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14721                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14722 00001418 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14723 0000141B 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14724 0000141D 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14725                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14726 00001422 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14727 00001424 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14728                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14729 00001428 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14730                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14731                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14732 0000142C C3                      		retn
 14733                                  
 14734                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14735                                  
 14736                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14737                                  
 14738                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14739                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14740                                  
 14741                                  move_sector:
 14742                                  
 14743                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14744                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14745                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14746                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14747                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14748                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14749                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14750                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14751                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14752                                  ;
 14753                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14754                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14755                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14756                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14757                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14758                                  
 14759 0000142D FC                      		cld
 14760 0000142E 51                      		push	cx
 14761 0000142F B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14762 00001432 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14763 00001436 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14764 00001438 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14765 0000143C 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14766 0000143E F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14767 00001440 59                      		pop	cx
 14768 00001441 C3                      		retn
 14769                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14770                                  
 14771                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14772 00001442 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14773 00001444 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14774 00001446 59                      		pop	cx
 14775 00001447 C3                      		retn
 14776                                  
 14777                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14778                                  
 14779                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14780                                  
 14781                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14782                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14783                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14784                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14785                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14786                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14787                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14788                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14789                                  ;
 14790                                  ; input conditions:
 14791                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14792                                  ;
 14793                                  ; output:
 14794                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14795                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14796                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14797                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14798                                  
 14799                                  check_wrap:	
 14800 00001448 50                      		push	ax
 14801 00001449 53                      		push	bx
 14802 0000144A 06                      		push	es
 14803 0000144B 57                      		push	di
 14804 0000144C E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14805 0000144F 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14806                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14807 00001451 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14808                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14809 00001456 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14810 00001458 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14811 0000145C 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14812 0000145E 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14813 00001461 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14814 00001463 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14815 00001465 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14816                                  
 14817                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14818                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14819                                  
 14820 00001467 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14821 00001469 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14822                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14823 0000146B 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14824 0000146C 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14825                                  					; if on	boundary
 14826                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14827                                  not_on_bound:
 14828 0000146E 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14829 00001471 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14830 00001473 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14831 00001475 40                      		inc	ax
 14832 00001476 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14833 00001478 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14834                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14835 0000147B 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14836 0000147F 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14837                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14838                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14839 00001481 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14840 00001483 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14841 00001484 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14842                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14843 00001486 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14844                                  
 14845                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14846                                  
 14847 00001488 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14848 0000148A 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14849 0000148C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14850                                  
 14851                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14852                                  
 14853 0000148E 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14854 00001490 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14855 00001492 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14856                                  no_head_bound:				
 14857 00001493 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14858 00001495 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14859 00001496 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14860 00001498 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14861 0000149A 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14862 0000149C 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14863 0000149F B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14864 000014A1 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14865 000014A3 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14866 000014A5 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14867 000014A7 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14868 000014A9 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14869 000014AB 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14870 000014AD 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14871                                  no_wrap:				
 14872 000014AF F8                      		clc
 14873 000014B0 5F                      		pop	di
 14874 000014B1 07                      		pop	es
 14875 000014B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 14876 000014B3 58                      		pop	ax
 14877 000014B4 C3                      		retn
 14878                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14879                                  
 14880                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14881 000014B5 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14882 000014B7 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14883 000014B9 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14884                                  
 14885                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14886                                  
 14887                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14888                                  
 14889                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14890                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14891                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14892                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14893                                  ;
 14894                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14895                                  
 14896                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14897                                  find_bds:	
 14898 000014BB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14899                                  fbds_1:					
 14900 000014BF 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14901 000014C3 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14902 000014C5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14903                                  					; go to next bds
 14904 000014C8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14905 000014CB 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14906 000014CD F9                      		stc
 14907                                  fdbs_2:					
 14908 000014CE C3                      		retn
 14909                                  
 14910                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14911                                  
 14912                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14913                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14914                                  doint:
 14915                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14916 000014CF 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14917                                  					; get physical drive number
 14918                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14919                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14920                                  		
 14921 000014D2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14922 000014D4 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14923 000014D6 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14924                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14925 000014D8 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14926                                  					; get request code
 14927                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14928 000014DB FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14929                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14930 000014DE 9D                      		popf
 14931                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14932                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14933 000014DF 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14934                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14935                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14936 000014E4 9C                      		pushf
 14937                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14938 000014E5 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14939                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14940                                  dointdone:				
 14941 000014E8 C3                      		retn
 14942                                  
 14943                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14944                                  
 14945                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14946                                  
 14947                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14948                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14949                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14950                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14951                                  ;
 14952                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14953                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14954                                  ;
 14955                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14956                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14957                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14958                                  
 14959                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14960                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14961                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14962                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14963                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14964                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14965                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14966                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14967                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14968                                  ;end struc
 14969                                  
 14970                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14971                                  
 14972                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14973                                  ;	ah = function
 14974                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14975                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14976                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14977                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14978                                  ;   output conditions:
 14979                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14980                                  
 14981                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14982                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14983                                  ;
 14984                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14985                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14986                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14987                                  
 14988                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14989                                  
 14990                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14991                                  
 14992 000014E9 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14993                                  
 14994                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14995                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14996                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14997                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14998                                  
 14999                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15000                                  
 15001                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 15002                                  
 15003                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 15004                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 15005                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 15006                                  
 15007                                  format_special_stuff:
 15008 000014ED 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 15009 000014F2 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 15010 000014F4 53                      		push	bx
 15011 000014F5 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 15012 000014F8 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 15013 000014FB 5B                      		pop	bx
 15014 000014FC EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 15015                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15016                                  
 15017                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15018                                  
 15019                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 15020                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 15021                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 15022                                  
 15023                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15024                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 15025 000014FE 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 15026 00001500 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 15027 00001502 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 15028 00001503 51                      		push	cx
 15029 00001504 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 15030 00001506 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 15031 00001508 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 15032 0000150A 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 15033 0000150E 59                      		pop	cx
 15034 0000150F 58                      		pop	ax
 15035 00001510 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15036                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 15037 00001512 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 15038 00001513 06                      		push	es
 15039                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15040 00001514 2EC41E[E914]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 15041                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 15042                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 15043 00001519 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 15044 0000151B 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 15045 0000151E 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 15046                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 15047                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 15048 00001522 07                      		pop	es
 15049 00001523 5B                      		pop	bx
 15050 00001524 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15051                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15052                                  
 15053                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15054                                  
 15055                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 15056                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 15057                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 15058                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 15059                                  
 15060                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 15061 00001526 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 15062                                  					; read driver parm ?
 15063 0000152B 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 15064 0000152D 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 15065                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 15066 00001532 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15067                                  ps2_30_problem:
 15068 00001534 50                      		push	ax
 15069 00001535 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 15070                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 15071                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15072 00001537 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15073                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 15074                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15075 0000153C 58                      		pop	ax
 15076 0000153D EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15077                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15078                                  
 15079                                  ; 17/10/2022
 15080                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15081                                  
 15082                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 15083                                  
 15084                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 15085                                  
 15086                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 15087                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 15088                                  
 15089                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15090 0000153F 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 15091                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 15092                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 15093 00001540 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 15094                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 15095                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 15096                                  
 15097                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 15098                                  
 15099 00001545 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 15100 00001548 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15101 0000154B 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 15102                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 15103                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 15104 0000154D 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 15105 00001552 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 15106                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 15107                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 15108                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 15109 00001554 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15110                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15111                                  		
 15112 00001559 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 15113                                  		
 15114 0000155A 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 15115                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 15116 0000155F 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 15117                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 15118                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 15119 00001561 9D                      		popf
 15120 00001562 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 15121                                  ret_from_i13:
 15122 00001564 1F                      		pop	ds
 15123 00001565 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 15124                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15125                                  
 15126                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 15127                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 15128                                  ; a changeline error.
 15129                                  
 15130                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 15131 00001568 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 15132                                  i13_ret_error:				
 15133 0000156A 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 15134 0000156D 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 15135 0000156F 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 15136 00001571 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 15137 00001573 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 15138 00001578 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 15139                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 15140                                  					; never	would
 15141 0000157A 53                      		push	bx
 15142 0000157B BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 15143 0000157E E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 15144 00001581 5B                      		pop	bx
 15145                                  int13b:
 15146 00001582 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 15147 00001583 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 15148                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15149                                  
 15150                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 15151                                  
 15152                                  goterr13:
 15153 00001585 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 15154 00001588 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 15155                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 15156 0000158A 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 15157 0000158D 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 15158 0000158F 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 15159 00001594 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 15160                                  
 15161 00001596 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 15162                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 15163                                  					; (2 = romread)
 15164                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 15165 0000159B 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 15166                                  
 15167 0000159D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 15168                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 15169                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15170 0000159F 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15171                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15172                                  					; call far 70:797h
 15173 000015A4 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 15174 000015A7 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 15175 000015A9 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 15176 000015AB 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 15177 000015AD 53                      		push	bx
 15178 000015AE 51                      		push	cx
 15179 000015AF 52                      		push	dx
 15180 000015B0 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 15181                                  loop_ecc:
 15182 000015B3 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15183                                  
 15184                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 15185                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 15186                                  ;
 15187                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 15188                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 15189                                  ; track.
 15190                                  ;
 15191                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 15192                                  ; this request.
 15193                                  ;
 15194                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 15195                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 15196                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 15197                                  ;
 15198 000015B6 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 15199                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 15200                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15201 000015B9 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15202                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15203 000015BE 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 15204 000015C0 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 15205 000015C3 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 15206 000015C5 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 15207 000015C8 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 15208                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15209                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 15210                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 15211 000015CA 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 15212                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 15213                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 15214                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 15215                                  ok11_op:
 15216 000015CC FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 15217 000015D0 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 15218 000015D2 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 15219                                  					; add 200h to address
 15220 000015D4 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15221 000015D6 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15222 000015D8 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 15223                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15224                                  
 15225                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 15226                                  
 15227                                  ok11_exit_err:
 15228 000015DA F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 15229                                  ok11_exit:
 15230 000015DB 5A                      		pop	dx
 15231 000015DC 59                      		pop	cx
 15232 000015DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 15233 000015DE EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15234                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15235                                  
 15236                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 15237                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 15238                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 15239                                  
 15240                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 15241 000015E0 06                      		push	es
 15242 000015E1 53                      		push	bx
 15243 000015E2 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15244 000015E5 1E                      		push	ds
 15245 000015E6 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 15246 000015E7 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15247                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 15248                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15249 000015EA 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15250                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15251 000015EF 5B                      		pop	bx
 15252 000015F0 07                      		pop	es
 15253 000015F1 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 15254 000015F3 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 15255 000015F6 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 15256                                  
 15257                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 15258                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 15259                                  
 15260                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 15261 000015F8 56                      		push	si
 15262 000015F9 57                      		push	di
 15263 000015FA 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15264 000015FC BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15265 000015FF E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 15266 00001602 5F                      		pop	di
 15267 00001603 5E                      		pop	si
 15268 00001604 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 15269                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15270                                  
 15271                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 15272                                  ; operation as best we can.
 15273                                  
 15274                                  gotdmaerr:
 15275 00001606 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 15276 00001609 FB                      		sti
 15277 0000160A 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 15278 0000160D 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15279                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 15280                                  					; functions we don't handle
 15281 0000160F 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 15282 00001612 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 15283 00001614 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15284 00001617 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 15285 00001619 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15286                                  
 15287                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 15288                                  
 15289                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 15290                                  
 15291 0000161B 52                      		push	dx
 15292 0000161C 51                      		push	cx
 15293 0000161D 53                      		push	bx
 15294 0000161E 50                      		push	ax
 15295 0000161F 55                      		push	bp
 15296 00001620 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 15297 00001622 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 15298 00001624 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15299 00001626 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15300 00001628 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15301 0000162A D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 15302 0000162C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 15303 0000162E 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 15304                                  
 15305                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 15306                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 15307                                  
 15308 00001632 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 15309 00001634 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 15310                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15311                                  
 15312                                  no_skip_first:
 15313 00001637 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 15314 00001639 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 15315 0000163B 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 15316                                  
 15317                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 15318                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 15319                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 15320                                  ;
 15321                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 15322                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 15323                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 15324                                  ; in error.
 15325                                  
 15326 0000163D 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 15327 0000163F 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 15328                                  
 15329                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 15330                                  
 15331 00001641 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15332                                  					; set up head number
 15333 00001644 E888FE                  		call	doint
 15334 00001647 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 15335                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15336                                  
 15337                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 15338 0000164A B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 15339 0000164C F9                      		stc
 15340 0000164D E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 15341                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 15342                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15343                                  
 15344                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 15345                                  
 15346                                  intverify:
 15347 00001650 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 15348 00001651 53                      		push	bx
 15349 00001652 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 15350 00001653 07                      		pop	es
 15351                                  dosimple:
 15352 00001654 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15353                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 15354                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 15355                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15356 00001657 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15357                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15358 0000165C 5B                      		pop	bx
 15359 0000165D 07                      		pop	es
 15360 0000165E E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15361                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15362                                  
 15363                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 15364                                  
 15365                                  intformat:
 15366 00001661 06                      		push	es
 15367 00001662 53                      		push	bx
 15368 00001663 56                      		push	si
 15369 00001664 57                      		push	di
 15370 00001665 1E                      		push	ds
 15371                                  
 15372                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 15373                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 15374                                  
 15375 00001666 06                      		push	es
 15376 00001667 1E                      		push	ds
 15377 00001668 07                      		pop	es
 15378 00001669 1F                      		pop	ds
 15379 0000166A 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 15380 0000166C BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 15381 0000166F E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 15382 00001672 1F                      		pop	ds
 15383 00001673 5F                      		pop	di
 15384 00001674 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 15385 00001675 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 15386                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15387                                  
 15388                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 15389                                  ; the first block.
 15390                                  ;
 15391                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 15392                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 15393                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 15394                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 15395                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 15396                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 15397                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 15398                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 15399                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 15400                                  
 15401                                  doblock:
 15402                                  
 15403                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 15404                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 15405                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 15406                                  				
 15407 00001677 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15408                                  					; get head #, drive #
 15409 0000167A 51                      		push	cx
 15410 0000167B 06                      		push	es
 15411 0000167C 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15412                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 15413 0000167D E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 15414 00001680 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 15415                                  		; 12/12/2022
 15416 00001684 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 15417                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 15418 00001689 5F                      		pop	di
 15419 0000168A 07                      		pop	es
 15420 0000168B 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 15421 0000168D 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 15422 0000168F B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 15423 00001691 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15424                                  doblockflop:
 15425 00001693 59                      		pop	cx
 15426                                  doblockcontinue:
 15427 00001694 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 15428 00001696 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 15429 00001698 50                      		push	ax
 15430 00001699 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 15431 0000169B EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 15432                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15433                                  
 15434                                  doblocklast:
 15435 0000169D 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 15436 0000169F 50                      		push	ax
 15437                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 15438 000016A0 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 15439 000016A3 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 15440 000016A5 58                      		pop	ax
 15441 000016A6 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 15442                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 15443 000016A9 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 15444 000016AB 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 15445 000016AD 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 15446 000016AF 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 15447 000016B1 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 15448                                  					; then we are done already.
 15449 000016B3 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15450                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15451 000016B5 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15452 000016B8 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15453                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15454                                  
 15455                                  bufferx:
 15456 000016BA 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15457                                  					; set up head number
 15458                                  buffer:
 15459 000016BD 53                      		push	bx
 15460 000016BE 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15461 000016C1 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15462 000016C4 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15463                                  
 15464                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15465                                  
 15466 000016C6 06                      		push	es
 15467 000016C7 1E                      		push	ds
 15468 000016C8 56                      		push	si
 15469 000016C9 57                      		push	di
 15470 000016CA 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15471 000016CB 06                      		push	es
 15472 000016CC 1F                      		pop	ds
 15473 000016CD 07                      		pop	es
 15474 000016CE BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15475 000016D1 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15476 000016D2 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15477 000016D4 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15478 000016D7 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15479                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15480 000016D8 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15481 000016D9 5E                      		pop	si
 15482 000016DA 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15483                                  
 15484                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15485                                  
 15486 000016DB B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15487                                  					; get drive number
 15488 000016DD 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15489 000016E0 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15490                                  					;
 15491                                  					; ah is	function
 15492                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15493                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15494                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15495                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15496                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15497 000016E3 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15498 000016E6 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15499 000016E7 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15500 000016E9 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15501                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15502                                  
 15503                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15504                                  
 15505                                  doread:
 15506 000016EB 06                      		push	es
 15507 000016EC 53                      		push	bx
 15508 000016ED 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15509 000016EE 07                      		pop	es
 15510 000016EF BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15511 000016F2 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15512 000016F4 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15513                                  					; get drive number
 15514 000016F7 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15515                                  					; ah = function
 15516                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15517                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15518                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15519 000016FA E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15520 000016FD 5B                      		pop	bx
 15521 000016FE 07                      		pop	es
 15522 000016FF 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15523 00001701 56                      		push	si
 15524 00001702 57                      		push	di
 15525 00001703 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15526 00001705 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15527 00001708 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15528 0000170B 5F                      		pop	di
 15529 0000170C 5E                      		pop	si
 15530                                  
 15531                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15532                                  
 15533                                  dotail:
 15534 0000170D 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15535 0000170E 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15536 00001711 41                      		inc	cx
 15537 00001712 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15538 00001715 F8                      		clc
 15539 00001716 FEC8                    		dec	al
 15540 00001718 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15541                                  
 15542                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15543                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15544                                  
 15545 0000171A 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15546 0000171D E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15547 00001720 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15548                                  
 15549                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15550                                  
 15551                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15552                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15553                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15554                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15555                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15556                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15557                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15558                                  
 15559                                  bad13:
 15560 00001723 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15561 00001725 5D                      		pop	bp
 15562 00001726 5B                      		pop	bx
 15563 00001727 5B                      		pop	bx
 15564 00001728 59                      		pop	cx
 15565 00001729 5A                      		pop	dx
 15566 0000172A 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15567 0000172C E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15568                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15569                                  
 15570                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 15571 0000172F E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15572                                  
 15573                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15574                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15575                                  		;db 	0
 15576                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15577                                  
 15578                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 15579                                  
 15580                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15581                                  
 15582                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15583                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 15584                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15585                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15586                                  
 15587                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15588                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 15589 00001732 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 15590 00001736 BF[7606]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 15591 00001739 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 15592 0000173A 07                      		pop	es
 15593 0000173B E912EF                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 15594                                  
 15595                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15596                                  
 15597                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15598                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15599                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15600                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15601                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15602                                  
 15603                                  install_bds:
 15604 0000173E 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15605 0000173F BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15606                                  
 15607                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15608                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15609                                  loop_next_bds:
 15610 00001742 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15611                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15612 00001744 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15613 00001748 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15614                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15615 0000174B 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15616 0000174D B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15617 0000174F 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15618                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15619 00001753 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15620 00001756 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15621                                  					; we don't own it
 15622 0000175B 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15623                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15624 0000175E 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15625 00001761 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15626                                  next_bds:
 15627                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15628 00001765 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15629 00001768 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15630                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15631                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 15632 0000176A 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 15633 0000176C 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 15634                                  					; install bds
 15635 0000176F 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 15636 00001771 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15637                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15638                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15639 00001774 1F                      		pop	ds
 15640                                  
 15641                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 15642                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 15643                                  
 15644                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 15645                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 15646                                  
 15647                                  		; 01/06/2019
 15648 00001775 268A4534                		mov	al,[es:di+52]
 15649                                  		; 22/07/2023
 15650                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 15651 00001779 3A06[2C01]              		cmp	al,[eot]
 15652 0000177D 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 15653 0000177F A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot],al
 15654                                  _eot_ok:
 15655 00001782 C3                      		retn
 15656                                  
 15657                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15658                                  
 15659                                  ; 17/10/2022

 15664                                  SNGMSG equ sngmsg

 15673                                  
 15674                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15675 00001783 F606[6608]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 15676                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 15677 00001788 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus

 15688 00001791 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 15689                                  					; get the drive	letter

 15692                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa

 15695 00001797 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1

 15697 0000179C B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 15698                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 15699                                  					; Broadcast it

 15702 000017A2 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 15703

 15705

 15707                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15708 000017A7 2E8816[E117]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl

 15718 000017B1 AC                      		lodsb			; get the next character of the message
 15719                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 15720                                  wrmsg_loop:

 15722                                  					; AL = character to display
