 16906                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16907                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 16908                                  
 16909                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 16910                                  
 16911                                  struc buffinfo
 16912 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 16913 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 16914 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16915                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 16916                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 16917 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 16918                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 16919                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 16920                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 16921                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 16922                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 16923                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 16924                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 16925                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 16926 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16927                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 16928 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 16929 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 16930 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 16931 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 16932 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 16933                                  .size:
 16934                                  endstruc
 16935                                  
 16936                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 16937                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 16938                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 16939                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 16940                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 16941                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 16942                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 16943                                  
 16944                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 16945                                  
 16946                                  
 16947                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 16948                                  
 16949                                  ;Flag byte masks
 16950                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 16951                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 16952                                  ;***
 16953                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 16954                                  ;***
 16955                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 16956                                  
 16957                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 16958                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 16959                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 16960                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 16961                                  
 16962                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 16966                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16967                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 16968                                  
 16969                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 16970                                  
 16971                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 16972                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 16973                                  ;
 16974                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 16975                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 16976                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 16977                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 16978                                  ;
 16979                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 16980                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 16981                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 16982                                  
 16983                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 16984                                  
 16985                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16986                                  
 16987                                  struc	DPB
 16988 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 16989 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 16990 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 16991 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 16992 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 16993 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 16994 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 16995 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 16996 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 16997 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 16998                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16999 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 17000 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 17001 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 17002 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 17003 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 17004                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 17005 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 17006 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 17007 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 17008                                  .size:
 17009                                  endstruc
 17010                                  
 17011                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 17012                                  
 17013                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 17070                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 17071                                  
 17072                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 17073                                  ;
 17074                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 17075                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 17076                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 17077                                  ;
 17078                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 17079                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 17080                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 17081                                  ;
 17082                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 17083                                  
 17084                                  struc A_BPB

 17363                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17364                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 17365                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17366                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 17367                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 17368                                  									  
 17369                                  ;*******************************					  
 17370                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 17371                                  ;*******************************					  
 17372                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 17373                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 17374                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 17375                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17376                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 17377                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 17378                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17379                                  ;For all others:							  
 17380                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 17381                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 17382                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 17383                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 17384                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 17385                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 17386                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 17387                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 17388                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17389                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 17390                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 17391                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 17392                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 17393                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 17394                                  ;									  
 17395                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 17396                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 17397                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17398                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 17399                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 17400                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 17401                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 17402                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 17403                                  ;									  
 17404                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 17405                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 17406                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 17407                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 17408                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 17409                                  ;									  
 17410                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 17411                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 17412                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 17413                                  ;									  
 17414                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 17415                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 17416                                  ;									  
 17417                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 17418                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 17419                                  ;									  
 17420                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 17421                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 17422                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 17423                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 17424                                  ;						called. 		  
 17425                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 17426                                  ;									  
 17427                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17428                                  ;									  
 17429                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17430                                  ;									  
 17431                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17432                                  ;									  
 17433                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17434                                  ;									  
 17435                                  
 17436                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 17437                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 17438 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 17439 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 17440                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 17441 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17442 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17443 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 17444 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 17445                                  endstruc

 17448                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 17449                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 17450                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b

 17452                                  					;;End of Modification

 17554                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17555                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17556                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17557                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17558                                  
 17559                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 17560                                  ;
 17561                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 17562                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 17563                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 17564                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 17565                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 17566                                  ;
 17567                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 17568                                  ;
 17569                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 17570                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 17571                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 17572                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 17573                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 17574                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 17575                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 17576                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 17577                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 17578                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 17579                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 17580                                  
 17581                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 17582                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 17583                                  
 17584                                  struc 		curdir_list
 17585                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17586 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 17587 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 17588 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 17589 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 17590 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 17591 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 17592                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 17593 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 17594 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 17595 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 17596                                  .size:
 17597                                  endstruc
 17598                                  
 17599                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 17600                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 17601                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 17602                                  						; argument
 17603                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 17604                                  
 17605                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 17606                                  
 17607                                  ;Flag word masks
 17608                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17609                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17610                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 17611                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 17612                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 17615                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17616                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17617                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 17620                                  
 17621                                  ; system file table
 17622                                  
 17623                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 17624                                  ;
 17625                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 17626                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 17627                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 17628                                  
 17629                                  struc	SF
 17630 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 17631 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 17632 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 17633                                  .size:
 17634                                  endstruc
 17635                                  
 17636                                  ;**	System file table entry
 17637                                  ;
 17638                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 17639                                  
 17640                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 17641 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 17642                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 17643 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 17644 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 17645 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 17646                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 17647                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 17648                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 17649                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 17650                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 17651                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 17652                                  					;   (WRITE)
 17653                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 17654                                  					;
 17655                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 17656                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 17657                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 17658                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 17659                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 17660                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 17661                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 17662                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 17663                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 17664                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 17665                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 17666                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 17667 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 17668                                  					; to device header if local device,
 17669                                  					; points to net device header if
 17670                                  					; remote
 17671 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 17672                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 17673 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 17674 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 17675 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 17676 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 17677                                  ;
 17678                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 17679                                  ; ID
 17680                                  ;
 17681 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 17682 0000001B ????????                .sf_dirsec:	resd	1 ; 09/04/2024	; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 17683 0000001F ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 17684                                  ;
 17685                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 17686                                  ;
 17687 00000020 <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 17688                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 17689                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 17690                                  					; disk changed errors.
 17691                                  ; SHARING INFO
 17692 0000002B ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 17693 0000002F ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 17694 00000031 ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 17695 00000033 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 17696 00000035 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 17697 00000037 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 17698                                  .size:
 17699                                  endstruc

 17978                                  ; 05/07/2018
 17979                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17980                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17981                                  
 17982                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17983                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 17984                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17985                                  
 17986                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 17987                                  ;
 17988                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 17989                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 17990                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 17991                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 17992                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 17993                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 17994                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 17995                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 17996                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 17997                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 17998                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 17999                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 18000                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 18001                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 18002                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 18003                                  ;
 18004                                  
 18005                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 18006                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 18007                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 18008                                  ;
 18009                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 18010                                  ;
 18011                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 18012                                  ;
 18013                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 18014                                  ;
 18015                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 18016                                  ;
 18017                                  
 18018                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 18019                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 18020                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 18021                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 18022                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 18023                                  ;      deeply nested one
 18024                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 18025                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 18026                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 18027                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 18028                                  
 18029                                  		;EVEN
 18030                                  ;align 2
 18031                                  		; 21/10/2022
 18032                                  
 18033 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 18034 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 18035 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 18036 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 18037 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 18038 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 18039                                  
 18040 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 18041 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 18042 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 18043                                  
 18044                                  ;***********************************************************************
 18045                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 18046                                  
 18047                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18048                                  
 18049 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 18050                                  
 18051                                  int02:
 18052                                  
 18053                                  ; *********************************************************************
 18054                                  ;
 18055                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 18056                                  ;
 18057                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 18058                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 18059                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 18060                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 18061                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 18062                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 18063                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 18064                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 18065                                  ;
 18066                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 18067                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 18068                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 18069                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 18070                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 18071                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 18072                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 18073                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 18074                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 18075                                  ;
 18076                                  ; *********************************************************************
 18077                                  
 18078 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 18079 00000017 06                      	push	es
 18080 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 18081 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18082                                  	; 02/11/2022
 18083 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 18084 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 18085 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 18086                                  
 18087 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 18088                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 18089                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 18090                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 18091                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 18092 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 18093 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 18094                                  special02:
 18095 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 18096 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 18097                                  normal02:
 18098 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 18099 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 18100 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 18328                                  ;********************************************************************
 18329                                  ;common routines
 18330                                  ;********************************************************************
 18331                                  
 18332                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 18333                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 18334                                  ; service routine
 18335                                  
 18336                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 18337                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18338                                  
 18339                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 18340                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 18341                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 18342                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 18343                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 18344                                  
 18345                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 18346                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 18347                                  
 18348                                  do_int_stacks:
 18349 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 18350 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 18351 00000149 06                      	push	es
 18352 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 18353 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 18354 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 18355                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18356                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 18357                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18358 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 18359 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 18360 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 18361                                  
 18362 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 18363                                  
 18364                                  found02:
 18365 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 18366 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 18367                                  
 18368 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 18369                                  
 18370 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 18371                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18372                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 18373                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18374                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 18375 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 18376 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 18377                                  
 18378                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 18379 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 18380 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 18381 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 18382 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 18383 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 18384 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 18385 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18386 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 18387                                  
 18388                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 18389                                  	;push    bp
 18390                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 18391                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 18392                                  	;pop     bp
 18393                                  	;push    es
 18394                                  	;pop     ss
 18395                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 18396                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 18397                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18398                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 18399                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 18400                                  
 18401 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 18402                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18403 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 18404                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18405                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 18406                                  
 18407 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 18408                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18409 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 18410                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18411                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 18412 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 18413 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 18414                                  
 18415                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18416                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 18417                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18418 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 18419 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 18420                                  
 18421 000001A8 07                      	pop	es
 18422 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 18423 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 18424 000001AB 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 18425 000001AE CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 18426                                  
 18427                                  notfree02:
 18428 000001AF 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 18429 000001B1 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 18430                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18431                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 18432                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18433 000001B3 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18434                                  
 18435                                  findnext02:
 18436 000001B7 E81200                  	call	longpath
 18437 000001BA EBA8                    	jmp	short found02
 18438                                  
 18439                                  foundbad02:
 18440 000001BC 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18441 000001C1 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 18442 000001C3 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 18443                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18444                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 18445                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18446 000001C5 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 18447 000001CA EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 18448                                  
 18449                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18450                                  
 18451                                  ; Common routines
 18452                                  
 18453                                  longpath:
 18454                                  	; 21/03/2019
 18455 000001CC 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 18456                                  lploopp:
 18457                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18458                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 18459                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18460 000001D1 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 18461 000001D6 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 18462                                  
 18463 000001D8 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 18464                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18465                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 18466                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18467 000001DA 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18468 000001DE 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 18469 000001E0 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 18470                                  
 18471 000001E2 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 18472 000001E4 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 18473                                  
 18474                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18475                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 18476                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18477 000001E6 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 18478                                  inuse:
 18479 000001EA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18480 000001EF 7406                    	je	short fatal
 18481 000001F1 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 18482 000001F4 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 18483                                  found:
 18484 000001F6 C3                      	retn
 18485                                  fatal:
 18486 000001F7 1E                      	push	ds
 18487 000001F8 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 18488 000001FB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18489 000001FD 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 18490 00000202 1F                      	pop	ds
 18491 00000203 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 18492                                  
 18493 00000205 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 18494 00000207 E672                    	out	72h,al
 18495                                  
 18496                                  skip_nmis:
 18497 00000209 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 18498 0000020A B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 18499 0000020C E621                    	out	021h,al
 18500 0000020E E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 18501                                  
 18502 00000210 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 18503 00000212 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 18504 00000214 BE[3B02]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 18505                                  ;SR;
 18506                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 18507                                  ;
 18508 00000217 50                      	push	ax
 18509 00000218 1E                      	push	ds
 18510                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 18511                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 18512                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18513 00000219 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 18514 0000021C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18515                                  
 18516                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 18517 0000021E F606[6608]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 18518 00000223 1F                      	pop	ds
 18519 00000224 58                      	pop	ax
 18520 00000225 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 18521                                  
 18522                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)

 19794                                  
 19795                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 19796                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 19797                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 19798                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 19799                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 19800                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 19801                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 19802                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 19803                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 19804                                  ;
 19805                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 19806                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 19807                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 19808                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 19809                                  ; been patched.
 19810                                  
 19811                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19812                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0749h)

 20139                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"

 20144 0000076B BA[8645]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 20145                                  
 20146                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 20147                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 20148                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 20149                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 20150                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 20151                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 20152                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 20153                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 20154                                  
 20155                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 20156                                  
 20157 0000076E 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 20158 0000076F BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 20160 00000774 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 20161 00000776 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 20162 00000778 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 20163 0000077A 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 20164                                  
 20165 0000077C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20166 0000077E B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 20167 00000780 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 20168 00000782 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 20169                                  
 20170                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 20171                                  
 20172                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 20173                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 20174                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 20175                                  
 20176                                  	; 22/10/2022
 20177                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 20179 00000788 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 20180                                  
 20181                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 20182                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 20183                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 20184                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 20185                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 20186                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 20187                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 20188                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 20189                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 20190                                  ;
 20191                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 20192                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 20193                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 20194                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 20195                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 20196                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 20197                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 20198                                  
 20199                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)

 21047                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 21048                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 21049                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 21050                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 21051                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 21052                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 21053                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 21054                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 21055                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 21056                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 21057                                  ;	  stub will go.
 21058                                  ;
 21059                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 21060                                  
 21061                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21062                                  update_arena:
 21063 00000A00 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 21064 00000A01 57                      	push	di
 21065 00000A02 51                      	push	cx
 21066 00000A03 52                      	push	dx
 21067                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21068                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 21069                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21070                                  	; ds = cs 
 21071 00000A04 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 21072 00000A08 4F                      	dec	di
 21073 00000A09 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 21074                                  						;  before sysvar
 21075 00000A0A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 21076                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 21077 00000A0C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 21078 00000A11 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 21079 00000A13 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 21080                                  
 21081                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 21082 00000A15 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 21083 00000A1A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 21084 00000A1C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 21085 00000A1E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 21086 00000A20 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21087                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 21088 00000A22 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 21089                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 21090 00000A26 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 21091 00000A2C 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 21092                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 21093 00000A2E 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 21094 00000A32 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 21095                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21096                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 21097 00000A34 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 21098 00000A37 5A                      	pop	dx
 21099 00000A38 59                      	pop	cx
 21100 00000A39 5F                      	pop	di
 21101 00000A3A 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 21102 00000A3B C3                      	retn
 21103                                  ;
 21104                                  ; M012 : END
 21105                                  ;
 21106                                  FatalErr:
 21107 00000A3C 0E                      	push	cs

 21109 00000A3E BA[0909]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 21110 00000A41 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21111 00000A43 CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21112                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21113                                  	; 30/12/2022 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21114 00000A45 E92007                  	jmp	stall

 21116                                  	;cli
 21117                                  	;hlt

 21123                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21124                                  ;
 21125                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 21126                                  ;
 21127                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 21128                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 21129                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 21130                                  ;
 21131                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 21132                                  ;
 21133                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21134                                  
 21135                                  AllocHMA:
 21136                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 21137                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 21138                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 21139                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 21140                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 21141                                  
 21142                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 21143                                  ;
 21144                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 21145                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 21146                                  ;	push	ax
 21147                                  ;	popf
 21148                                  ;	pushf
 21149                                  ;	pop	ax
 21150                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 21151                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 21152                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 21153                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 21154                                  
 21155                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21156                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 21157                                  
 21158 00000A48 1E                      	push	ds
 21159                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 21160                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 21161                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21162 00000A49 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 21163 00000A4C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21164                                  
 21165 00000A4E E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 21166 00000A51 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 21167                                  
 21168 00000A53 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 21169 00000A56 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 21170                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 21171                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 21172                                  
 21173 00000A58 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 21174                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 21175 00000A5C 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 21176                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 21177                                  
 21178 00000A60 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 21179 00000A62 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 21180                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 21181 00000A65 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 21182 00000A69 48                      	dec	ax
 21183 00000A6A 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 21184                                  
 21185                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 21186                                  
 21187 00000A6C B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 21188 00000A6E CD15                    	int	15h
 21189                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 21190                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 21191                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 21192 00000A70 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 21193                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 21194                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21195 00000A73 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 21196                                  allocHMA_1:
 21197 00000A75 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 21198                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 21199 00000A77 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 21200 00000A7B 48                      	dec	ax
 21201 00000A7C 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 21202                                  
 21203 00000A7E E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 21204 00000A81 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 21205                                  
 21206 00000A83 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 21207 00000A86 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21208 00000A88 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 21209 00000A8F 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 21210                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 21211                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21212 00000A96 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 21213                                  
 21214                                  ; 11/12/2022
 21215                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 21216                                  ;	; cf=0
 21217                                  ;	;clc
 21218                                  ;	pop	ds
 21219                                  ;	retn
 21220                                  
 21221                                  grabhma_error:
 21222 00000A98 F9                      	stc
 21223                                  	; 11/12/022
 21224                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 21225                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 21226 00000A99 1F                      	pop	ds
 21227 00000A9A C3                      	retn

 21232                                  ;
 21233                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 21234                                  ;

 21236                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present

 21240                                  IsXMSLoaded:

 21243                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 21244                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver

 21286 00000ABA 5E                      	pop	si

 21290 00000ABE 58                      	pop	ax

 21292 00000ABF CB                      	retf
 21293                                  
 21294                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21295                                  ;
 21296                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 21297                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 21298                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 21299                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 21300                                  ;
 21301                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 21302                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 21303                                  ;
 21304                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21305                                  
 21306                                  StartVDHead:
 21307                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 21308                                  
 21309 00000AC0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 21310 00000AC4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 21311 00000AC6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 21312 00000AC8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 21313 00000ACA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 21314                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 21315 00000ACB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 21316                                  VDiskSig1:
 21317 00000AD2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21318                                  
 21319                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 21320                                  
 21321 00000AD7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 21322                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 21323 00000ADD 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 21324 00000AEC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 21325 00000AEE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 21326                                  VDInt19:
 21327 00000AEF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 21328                                  OldVDInt19:
 21329 00000AF0 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 21330                                  
 21331                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 21332                                  
 21333                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 21334 00000AF4 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 21335                                  VDiskSig2:
 21336 00000AF7 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21337                                  
 21338                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 21339                                  
 21340 00000AFC 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 21341 00000AFF 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 21342 00000B01 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 21343 00000B02 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 21344 00000B04 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 21345 00000B05 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 21346 00000B07 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 21347 00000B09 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 21348 00000B0A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 21349 00000B0C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 21350 00000B0E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 21351 00000B10 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 21352 00000B12 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 21353                                  
 21354                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 21355                                  
 21356                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21357                                  ;
 21358                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 21359                                  ;
 21360                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 21361                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 21362                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0

 21500                                  
 21501                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 21502                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21503                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 21504                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 21505                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 21506                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 21507                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 21508                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 21509                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 21510                                  ;								      ;I070
 21511                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 21512                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 21513                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 21514                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 21515                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 21516                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 21517                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 21518                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 21519                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 21520                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 21521                                  ;								      ;I070
 21522                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 21523                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21524                                  
 21525                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21526                                  	; ds = cs
 21527                                  
 21528                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21529                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 21530                                  
 21531 00000BBC 06                      	push	es
 21532 00000BBD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 21533 00000BBF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 21534 00000BC1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 21535 00000BC3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 21536 00000BC5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21537 00000BC7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 21538 00000BC9 05[9C0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 21539 00000BCC 80D200                  	adc	dl,0

 21541                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 21542                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 21543                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax

 21568                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.

 21570                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 21571                                  ;		the offset.

 21583                                  	;
 21584 00000BEA 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 21585 00000BEC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment

 21588                                  	;

 21590 00000BF4 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 21591 00000BF7 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 21592 00000BFA B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21593 00000BFC D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 21594 00000BFE 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 21595                                  	;
 21596                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21597                                  	;push	ds
 21598                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 21599                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h

 21603                                  	;mov	ds,ax

 21606 00000C04 1F                      	pop	ds

 21650                                  ; procedure : CPMHack

 21653                                  ;		for CPM compatibility

 21664 00000C33 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 21665 00000C34 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 21666 00000C36 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 21667 00000C39 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h

 21669 00000C3C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 21670 00000C3E FC                      	cld
 21671 00000C3F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 21672 00000C41 1F                      	pop	ds
 21673 00000C42 C3                      	retn

 22282                                  ; if memory size > 128 kb (2000h para),then default buffers = 5
 22283                                  ; if memory size > 256 kb (4000h para),then default buffers = 10

 22593                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 22594                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 22595                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 22596                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 22597                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 22598                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 22599                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 22600                                  ;
 22601                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 22602                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 22603                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 22604                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 22605                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 22606                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 22607                                  ;
 22608                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 22609                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 22610                                  ;
 22611                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 22612                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 22613                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 22614                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 22615                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 22616                                  ;
 22617                                  ;	for round-up machine
 22618                                  ;
 22619                                  ;			  none.
 22620                                  
 22621                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 22622                                  ;
 22623                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 22624                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 22625                                  
 22626                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22627                                  
 22628 00000FCB 50                      	push	ax
