 22832                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22833                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22834                                  ;
 22835                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22836                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22837                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22838                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22839                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22840                                  ; program).

 22843

 22848                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.

 22851                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22852                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22853                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22854                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22855                                  ; carridge return.

 22857                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22858                                  ;character after =.

 22862 000010B6 07                      	pop	es

 22864 000010B8 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22865

 22867 000010BC FC                      	cld

 23003                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23004                                  
 23005                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 23006                                  ;
 23007                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 23008                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 23009                                  ;
 23010                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 23011                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 23012                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 23013                                  
 23014                                  ParaRound:
 23015 0000112F 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 23016 00001132 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 23017 00001134 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 23018 00001136 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 23019 00001138 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 23020 0000113A C3                      	retn
 23021                                  
 23022                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23023                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 23024                                  ;
 23025                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 23026                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 23027                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 23028                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 23029                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 23030                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 23031                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 23032                                  ;
 23033                                  ;in: after relocation,
 23034                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 23035                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 23036                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 23037                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 23038                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 23039                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 23040                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 23041                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 23042                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 23043                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 23044                                  ;
 23045                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 23046                                  
 23047                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23048                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23049                                  sysinit_base:				
 23050 0000113B 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 23051 00001140 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 23052 00001145 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 23053 00001147 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 23054 0000114C 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 23055 00001151 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 23056 00001152 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 23057 00001153 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 23058                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 23059                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 23060 00001155 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 23061 00001158 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 23062 0000115D 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 23063                                  
 23064                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 23065                                  
 23066 0000115F B409                    	mov	ah,9
 23067 00001161 0E                      	push	cs
 23068 00001162 1F                      	pop	ds
 23069                                  	; 30/12/2022
 23070                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 23071                                  	;mov	dx,102
 23072 00001163 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23073                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 23074 00001166 CD21                    	int	21h
 23075                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 23076                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 23077                                  
 23078                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 23079                                  stall:
 23080                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23081                                  _stall: 
 23082                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23083 00001168 F4                      	hlt 
 23084                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23085                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 23086 00001169 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 23087                                  
 23088                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 23089 0000116B 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 23090                                  
 23091                                  ;-------------------------------------
 23092                                  
 23093                                  sum_up:
 23094                                  
 23095                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 23096                                  ;out:  ax - result
 23097                                  ;
 23098                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 23099                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 23100                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 23101                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 23102                                  ;
 23103                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 23104                                  
 23105 00001170 1E                      	push	ds
 23106                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 23107                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 23108 00001171 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 23109                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23110                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 23111 00001175 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 23112 00001177 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 23113 00001179 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23114 0000117B 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 23115                                  					; whole test better fail.
 23116 00001180 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 23117 00001182 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 23118                                  sum1:
 23119 00001184 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 23120 00001186 46                      	inc	si
 23121 00001187 46                      	inc	si
 23122 00001188 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 23123                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 23124                                  sum_sys_code:
 23125                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23126 0000118A BE8A11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23127                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23128                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 23129                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 23130                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 23131                                  	; 02/11/2022
 23132                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 23133                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 23134 0000118D B9[504D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 23135 00001190 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 23136 00001192 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 23137                                  sum2:
 23138 00001194 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 23139 00001197 46                      	inc	si
 23140 00001198 46                      	inc	si
 23141 00001199 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 23142 0000119B 1F                      	pop	ds
 23143 0000119C C3                      	retn
 23144                                  
 23145                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23146                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23147                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 23148                                  
 23149                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 23150                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h)

 23154 0000119F 0000                    	dw	0

 23168                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23169                                  ; Set_Buffer
 23170                                  ;
 23171                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 23172                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 23173                                  ;
 23174                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 23175                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 23176                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 23177                                  ;
 23178                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 23179                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 23180                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23181                                  
 23182                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23183                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 23184                                  
 23185                                  set_buffer:
 23186 000011BC 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 23187 000011BE E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 23188 000011C1 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 23189                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 23190                                  	; 17/09/2023
 23191 000011C3 FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 23192                                  set_buff_1:
 23193                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23194                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 23195 000011C5 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 23196                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 23197 000011C7 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 23198                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 23199 000011CA C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 23200                                  
 23201 000011CF 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 23202 000011D1 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 23203 000011D6 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 23204                                  
 23205                                  ;	for each buffer
 23206                                  
 23207                                  nxt_buff:
 23208 000011D7 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 23209 000011DA 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 23210 000011DC E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 23211                                  
 23212 000011DE 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 23213                                  
 23214 000011E3 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 23215                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 23216 000011E4 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 23217 000011E7 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 23218                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 23219                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23220 000011E9 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 23221                                  
 23222 000011ED 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 23223 000011EF 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 23224                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 23225 000011F1 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 23226 000011F5 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 23227                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 23228 000011F9 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 23229                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 23230 000011FE 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 23231 00001201 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 23232                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 23233                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 23234                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 23235 00001205 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 23236                                  set_buff_2:
 23237 00001208 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 23238                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 23239 0000120D 2E800E[9E14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 23240                                  	;call	round
 23241                                  	;retn
 23242                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23243 00001213 E93430                  	jmp	round
 23244                                  
 23245                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23246                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 23247                                  ;
 23248                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 23249                                  ;
 23250                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 23251                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 23252                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23253                                  
 23254                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 23255                                  GetBufferAddr:
 23256 00001216 53                      	push	bx
 23257 00001217 52                      	push	dx
 23258 00001218 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 23259 0000121C 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 23260                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 23261 00001221 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 23262                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23263                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 23264                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23265 00001224 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 23266 00001226 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 23267 00001228 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 23268                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 23269 0000122B CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; DOS 5+ - ALLOCATE HMA SPACE
 23270                                  			;     AX = 4A02h
 23271                                  			;     BX = number of bytes
 23272                                  			; Return:
 23273                                  			;     ES:DI -> start of allocated HMA block or FFFFh:FFFFh
 23274                                  			;     BX = number of bytes actually allocated
 23275                                  			;	   (rounded up to next paragraph)
 23276                                  			; Notes:
 23277                                  			;     this call is not valid unless DOS is loaded in the HMA
 23278                                  			;     (DOS=HIGH)
 23279                                  
 23280 0000122D 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 23281 00001230 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 23282                                  	
 23283                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 23284                                  	; 05/09/2023
 23285                                  	; zf=1
 23286 00001232 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 23287                                  	; zf=1
 23288                                  	
 23289                                  	;zf=1
 23290                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 23291                                  	;zf=1
 23292 00001233 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 23293                                  got_hma:
 23294 00001238 5A                      	pop	dx
 23295 00001239 5B                      	pop	bx
 23296 0000123A C3                      	retn
 23297                                  
 23298                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23299                                  
 23300                                  set_buffer_info:
 23301                                  
 23302                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 23303                                  ;
 23304                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 23305                                  ;    ax = di
 23306                                  ;
 23307                                  ;out:
 23308                                  ;    above entries set.
 23309                                  
 23310                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 23311 0000123B 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 23312                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 23313 00001240 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 23314 00001244 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 23315 00001248 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 23316                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 23317 0000124D 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 23318                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 23319 00001250 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 23320                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 23321 00001256 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 23322                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 23323 0000125C 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 23324 00001262 C3                      	retn

 23326                                  ; ======================================================================
 23327                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 23328                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23329                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23330                                  
 23331                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23332                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 23333                                  ;
 23334                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 23335                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 23336                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 23337                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 23338                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 23339                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 23340                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 23341                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 23342                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 23343                                  ;
 23344                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 23345                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 23346                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 23347                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 23348                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 23349                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 23350                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 23351                                  ;	conditions:
 23352                                  ;
 23353                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 23354                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 23355                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 23356                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 23357                                  ;
 23358                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 23359                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 23360                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 23361                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 23362                                  ;
 23363                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 23364                                  ;
 23365                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 23366                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 23367                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 23368                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 23369                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 23370                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 23371                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 23372                                  ;	interrupt line.
 23373                                  ;
 23374                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 23375                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 23376                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 23377                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 23378                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 23379                                  ;
 23380                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 23381                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 23382                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 23383                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 23384                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 23385                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 23386                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 23387                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 23388                                  ;
 23389                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 23390                                  
 23391                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23392                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 23393                                  
 23394                                  	; 14/12/2022
 23395                                  stackinit:
 23396 00001263 50                      	push	ax
 23397 00001264 1E                      	push	ds
 23398 00001265 06                      	push	es
 23399 00001266 53                      	push	bx
 23400 00001267 51                      	push	cx
 23401 00001268 52                      	push	dx
 23402 00001269 57                      	push	di
 23403 0000126A 56                      	push	si
 23404 0000126B 55                      	push	bp
 23405                                  
 23406                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 23407                                  
 23408                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23409                                  	; ds = cs
 23410 0000126C A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 23411 0000126F 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 23412                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23413                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 23414                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 23415 00001271 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 23416                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 23419                                  	; 12/12/2022

 23421                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23422                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 23423                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 23424 0000127F 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 23425                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23426 00001283 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*

 23434

 23441

 23443

 23449 00001296 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 23450 00001298 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 23451 0000129C 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 23452 0000129E 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 23453                                  
 23454                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 23455                                  
 23456 000012A1 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 23457 000012A6 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]

 23460 000012AE 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23461 000012B0 06                      	push	es
 23462 000012B1 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 23463                                  
 23464                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 23465                                  
 23466 000012B2 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 23467 000012B6 FC                      	cld
 23468 000012B7 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 23469                                  
 23470 000012B9 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 23471                                  
 23472                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 23473                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 23474                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 23475                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 23476                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 24199 00001430 5A                      	pop	dx
 24200                                  		
 24201                                  	;cmp	dx,0
 24202                                  	;je	short int_xx_first
 24203                                  	; 05/09/2023
 24204 00001431 21D2                    	and	dx,dx
 24205 00001433 741E                    	jz	short int_xx_first
 24206                                  	
 24207 00001435 803FCF                  	cmp	byte [bx],0CFh
 24208 00001438 7419                    	je	short int_xx_first
 24209                                  	
 24210 0000143A 817F064B42              	cmp	word [bx+6],424Bh
 24211 0000143F 7411                    	je	short int_xx_not_first
 24212                                  	
 24213 00001441 81FA00F0                	cmp	dx,0F000h
 24214 00001445 750B                    	jne	short int_xx_not_first
 24215                                  
 24216 00001447 06                      	push	es
 24217                                  	;push	dx
 24218                                  	;mov	dx,0F000h
 24219 00001448 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 24220 0000144A 263B1E01FF              	cmp	bx,[es:0FF01h]
 24221                                        	;pop	dx
 24222 0000144F 07                      	pop	es
 24223 00001450 7401                    	je	short int_xx_first
 24224                                  
 24225                                  int_xx_not_first:
 24226 00001452 F9                      	stc
 24227                                  int_xx_first:
 24228 00001453 1F                      	pop	ds
 24229 00001454 C3                      	retn
 24230                                  
 24231                                  ;%endif
 24232                                  
 24233                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24234                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24235                                  
 24236                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24237                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 24238                                  
 24239                                  ; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24240                                  ; (SYSINIT:1745h)
 24241                                  
 24242                                  new_init_loop:
 24243                                  
 24244                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 24245                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 24246                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 24247                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 24248                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 24249                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 24250                                  
 24251                                  ; 13/04/2024
 24252                                  %if 0
 24253                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 24254                                  	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 24255                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 24256                                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 24257                                  
 24258                                  	push	ds
 24259                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 24260                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 24261                                  	; 21/10/2022
 24262                                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 24263                                  	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 24264                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 24265                                  	mov	[di],ax
 24266                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 24267                                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 24268                                  	pop	ds
 24269                                  %else
 24270                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2
 24271 00001455 1E                      	push	ds
 24272 00001456 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 24273 0000145A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 24274 0000145D 50                      	push	ax
 24275 0000145E 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 24276 00001461 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 24277 00001463 50                      	push	ax
 24278 00001464 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 24279 00001467 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 24280 00001469 58                      	pop	ax			;int 19 handler
 24281 0000146A 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 24282 0000146C 58                      	pop	ax
 24283 0000146D 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 24284 00001470 1F                      	pop	ds
 24285                                  %endif
 24286 00001471 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 24287 00001474 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 24288 00001478 C3                      	retn
 24289                                  
 24290                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 24536                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 24537                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE

 24572 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 24573 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number

 24575                                  endstruc
 24576                                  
 24577                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24578                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 24579                                  ;
 24580                                  ;
 24581                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 24582                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 24583                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24584                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24585                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24586                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24587                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24588                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24589                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24590                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24591                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24592                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 24593                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 24594                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 24595                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 24596                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 24597                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 24598                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 24599                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 24600                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 24601                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 24602                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 24603                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 24604                                  ;	   :
 24605                                  ;
 24606                                  ;Note:
 24607                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 24608                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 24609                                  ;
 24610                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 24611                                  ;
 24612                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 24613                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 24614                                  ;
 24615                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 24616                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 24617                                  ;
 24618                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 24619                                  ;
 24620                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 24621                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 24622                                  ;
 24623                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24624                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 24625                                  ;
 24626                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 24627                                  ;
 24628                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24629                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 24630                                  ;
 24631                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24632                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24633                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24634                                  ;
 24635                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 24636                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 24637                                  ;
 24638                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 24639                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 24640                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 24641                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24642                                  
 24643                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 24644                                  
 24645                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 24646                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 24647                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 24648                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 24649                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 24650                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 24651                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 24652                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 24653                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 24654                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 24655                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 24656                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 24657                                  
 24658                                  ;**** Function flags
 24659                                  
 24660                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 24661                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 24662                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 24663                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 24664                                  
 24665                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 24666                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 24667 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 24668 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 24669 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 24670 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 24671 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 24672 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 24673                                  endstruc
 24674                                  
 24675                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24676                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 24677                                  ;
 24678                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 24679                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 24680                                  ;	     +-
 24681                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 24682                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 24683                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 24684                                  ;	     |	:
 24685                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24686                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 24687                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 24688                                  ;	     |	:
 24689                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24690                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 24691                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 24692                                  ;	     +-	:
 24693                                  ;
 24694                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 24695                                  ;
 24696                                  ;Note:
 24697                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 24698                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 24699                                  ;
 24700                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24701                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24702                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24703                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24704                                  
 24705                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 24706                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 24707                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 24708                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 24709                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 24710                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 24711                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 24712                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 24713                                  
 24714                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 24715 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 24716 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 24717 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 24718 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 24719 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 24720                                  endstruc
 24721                                  
 24722                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24723                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 24724                                  ;
 24725                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 24726                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 24727                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 24728                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 24729                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 24730                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 24731                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 24732                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24733                                  ;
 24734                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24735                                  ;
 24736                                  ;            +-
 24737                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24738                                  ;	    | or
 24739                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24740                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24741                                  ;	    | or
 24742                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24743                                  ;	    | or
 24744                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24745                                  ;	    | or
 24746                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24747                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24748                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24749                                  ;	    | or
 24750                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24751                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24752                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24753                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24754                                  ;	    +-
 24755                                  ;
 24756                                  ;
 24757                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24758                                  ;      list.
 24759                                  ;
 24760                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24761                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24762                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24763                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24764                                  
 24765                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 24766                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 24767 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 24768 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 24769 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24770 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24771                                  endstruc

 24796                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 24797                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 24798                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 24799                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 24800                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24801                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 24802                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24888                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24889                                  ; SysParse;
 24890                                  ;
 24891                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24892                                  ;
 24893                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24894                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24895                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24896                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24897                                  ;
 24898                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24899                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24900                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24901                                  ;
 24902                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24903                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24904                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24905                                  ;
 24906                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24907                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24908                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24909                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24910                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24911                                  ;
 24912                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24913                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24914                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24915                                  ;
 24916                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24917                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24918                                  ;
 24919                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24920                                  ;
 24921                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24922                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24923                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24924                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24925                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24926                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24927                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24928                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24929                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24930                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24931                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24932                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24933                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24934                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24935                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24936                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24937                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24938                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24939                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24940                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24941                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24942                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24943                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24944                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24945                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24946                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24947                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24948                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24949                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24950                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24951                                  
 24952                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24953                                  
 24954                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24955                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24956                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24957                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24958                                  
 24959                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24960                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24961                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24962                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24963                                  ;
 24964                                  
 24965                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24966                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24967                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24968                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24969                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24970                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24971                                  
 24972                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24973                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24974                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24975                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24976                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24977                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24978                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24979                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24980                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24981                                  
 24982                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24983                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24984                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24985                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24986                                  ;	     segment.
 24987                                  
 24988                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24989                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24990                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24991                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24992                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24993                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.

 25589                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 25590                                  ;
 25591                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 25592                                  ;
 25593                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 25594                                  ;	    AL = type
 25595                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 25596                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 25597                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 25598                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 25599                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 25600                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 25601                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 25602                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25603                                  ;
 25604                                  ; Output:   None
 25605                                  ;
 25606                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 25607                                  ;

 26006                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 26007                                  ;
 26008                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 26009                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 26010                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 26011                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 26012                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 26013                                  ;
 26014                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 26015                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 26017                                  ; Output:    None
 26018                                  ;
 26019                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 26020                                  ;
 26021                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)

 26023                                  
 26024                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26025                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 26026                                  
 26027                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26028                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 26029                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 26030 0000190B 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26031 0000190C 2E800E[B214]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 26032 00001912 2E8026[B214]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 26033                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 26034 00001918 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 26035 0000191B 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 26036 0000191D 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 26037                                  
 26038 0000191F 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 26039 00001921 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 26040                                  
 26041 00001923 2E800E[B214]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 26042                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;

 26980                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26981                                  
 26982                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26983 00001C4D 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26984 00001C4E 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26985 00001C4F 2EC606[AC14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26986                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26987                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26988 00001C55 2E8026[B214]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26989 00001C5B 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26990 00001C5D 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26991                                  
 26992 00001C5F 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26993 00001C61 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26994                                  
 26995 00001C63 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26996 00001C65 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26997                                  
 26998                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26999                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 27000                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 27001                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 27002                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 27003                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 27004                                  %if 0
 27005                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27006                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 27007                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 27008                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 27009                                  
 27010                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 27011                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 27012                                  
 27013                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 27014                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 27015                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 27016                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 27017                                  %endif
 27018                                  
 27019                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 27020 00001C67 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 27021                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 27022 00001C6C 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 27023                                  
 27024                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 27025 00001C6E 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 27026                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 27027 00001C70 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 27028                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 27029                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 27030                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 27031                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27032 00001C74 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 27033                                  
 27034 00001C76 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 27035                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 27036 00001C79 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 27037 00001C7A 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 27038 00001C7D 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 27039                                  
 27040 00001C7F E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 27041

 27044                                  	; 08/07/2023

 27046 00001C81 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 27047                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 27048                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;

 27054 00001C85 2EA2[AC14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 27055 00001C89 2EF606[B214]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=

 27057

 27059                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 27060                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;

 27062 00001C99 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 27064                                  ;***********************************************************************
 27065                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 27066                                  ;
 27067                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 27068                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 27069                                  ;
 27070                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 27071                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 27072                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 27073                                  ;
 27074                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 27075                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 27076                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 27077                                  
 27078                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 27079                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 27080                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 27081                                  ;
 27082                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 27083                                  
 27084                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 27085                                  ;***********************************************************************
 27086                                  
 27087                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 27088                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 27089                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 27090                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27091 00001C9B BD[BB14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 27092                                  
 27093                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 27094 00001C9E 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 27095 00001CA0 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 27096                                  
 27097                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 27098 00001CA2 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27099 00001CA4 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 27100                                  
 27101 00001CA6 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 27102                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27103                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27104 00001CA7 C3                      	retn
 27105                                  
 27106                                  ; 12/12/2022
 27107                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 27108                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 27109                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 27110                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 27111                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27112                                  
 27113                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 27114                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 27115 00001CA8 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27116 00001CAA 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 27117                                  
 27118 00001CAC 2E800E[B214]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 27119                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27120                                  
 27121                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27122                                  	; cf=0
 27123                                  	;retn
 27124                                  
 27125                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 27126                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27127                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 27128 00001CB2 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 27129                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27130                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 27131 00001CB3 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
