 27133                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27134                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27135                                  ;
 27136                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 27137                                  ;
 27138                                  ;  Input:
 27139                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 27140                                  ;
 27141                                  ;  Output:
 27142                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 27143                                  ;
 27144                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 27145                                  ;
 27146                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 27147                                  ;***************************************************************************
 27148                                  
 27149                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27150 00001CB4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 27151 00001CB5 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 27152 00001CB6 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27153                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 27154                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 27155                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27156 00001CB7 2E8B36[AF14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 27157 00001CBC 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 27158 00001CBE 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 27159 00001CC0 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 27160 00001CC1 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27161 00001CC2 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 27162 00001CC3 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 27163 00001CC4 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 27164 00001CC5 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 27165 00001CC6 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 27166                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 27167                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 27168 00001CC7 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 27169 00001CC9 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 27170 00001CCC CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 27171                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 27172 00001CCE 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27173 00001CD0 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27174 00001CD2 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 27175 00001CD3 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 27176 00001CD4 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 27177 00001CD5 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 27178 00001CD6 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 27179 00001CD7 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27180 00001CD8 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 27181 00001CD9 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 27182                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 27183 00001CDB 2E8936[AD14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 27184 00001CE0 2E891E[AF14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 27185                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 27186                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 27187                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 27188                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27189 00001CE5 2EC536[AD14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 27190                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 27191 00001CEA 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 27192 00001CED 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 27193 00001CEF 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 27194 00001CF1 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 27195 00001CF3 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 27196 00001CF6 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 27197 00001CF8 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 27198 00001CF9 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 27199                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 27200 00001CFB 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 27201 00001CFC 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 27202                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 27203 00001CFD EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 27204                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 27205                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27206                                  	; cf=0
 27207                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 27208                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 27209 00001CFF 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27210 00001D00 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 27211 00001D01 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 27212 00001D02 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27774                                  
 27775                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 27776                                  
 27777                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27778                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27779                                  
 27780                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27781                                  ;
 27782                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27783                                  ;
 27784                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27785                                  ;
 27786                                  ;   Modification log:
 27787                                  ;
 27788                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27789                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27790                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27791                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27792                                  ;
 27793                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27794                                  ;
 27795                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27796                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27797                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27798                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27799                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27800                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27801                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27802                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27803                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27804                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27805                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27806                                  ;
 27807                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27808                                  
 27809                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27810                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27811                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27812                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27813                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27814                                  
 27815                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27816                                  
 27817                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27818                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27819                                  
 27820                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27821                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27822                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27823                                  
 27824                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27825                                  ;
 27826                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27827                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27828                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27829                                  ;	           line.
 27830                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27831                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27832                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27833                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27834                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27835                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27836                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27837                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27838                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27839                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27840                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27841                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27842                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27843                                  ;	           for details).
 27844                                  
 27845 00001F02 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27846 00001F03 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27847 00001F04 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27848 00001F06 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27849 00001F07 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27850 00001F17 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27851 00001F37 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27852 00001F38 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27853 00001F39 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27854                                  
 27855                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27856                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27857                                  
 27858                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27859                                  
 27860                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27861                                  
 27862                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 27863                                  
 27864                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 27865                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 27866                                  
 27867                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27868                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27869                                  
 27870                                  		;public	DevEntry
 27871                                  
 27872 00001F3A 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 27873 00001F3C 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded

 27877                                  ; 30/12/2022

 27880                                  ;

 27884 00001F4E 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)

 27894                                  ;

 27986                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27987                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27988                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27989                                  ;
 27990                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27991                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27992                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27993                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27994                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27995                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27996                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27997                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27998                                  ;

 28000 00001FB6 8916[9714]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 28001 00001FBA 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 28002                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 28023 00001FCD 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 28024

 28033                                  
 28034                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 28035                                  
 28036 00001FD7 50                      	push	ax
 28037 00001FD8 57                      	push	di
 28038 00001FD9 51                      	push	cx
 28039 00001FDA B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 28040 00001FDC 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 28041 00001FDE E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 28042 00001FE0 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 28043 00001FE2 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 28044                                  
 28045                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 28046                                  
 28047 00001FE4 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 28048                                  
 28049                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 28050                                  
 28051                                  puteol:
 28052 00001FE5 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 28053 00001FE7 AA                      	stosb
 28054 00001FE8 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 28055 00001FEA AA                      	stosb
 28056 00001FEB 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 28057                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28058                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 28059                                  
 28060                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 28061                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28062 00001FED 0E                      	push	cs
 28063 00001FEE 1F                      	pop	ds
 28064                                  
 28065 00001FEF 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 28066                                  
 28067 00001FF3 59                      	pop	cx
 28068 00001FF4 5F                      	pop	di
 28069 00001FF5 58                      	pop	ax
 28070                                  
 28071                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28072                                  	; 27/10/2022
 28073                                  	;push	cs
 28074                                  	;pop	ds
 28075                                  
 28076 00001FF6 50                      	push	ax
 28077                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 28078 00001FF7 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 28079 00001FF9 CD21                    	int	21h
 28080 00001FFB 58                      	pop	ax
 28081 00001FFC 9D                      	popf
 28082 00001FFD 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 28083 00001FFF 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 28084 00002001 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 28085                                  conferr:
 28086 00002003 BA[2A45]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 28087 00002006 E87724                  	call	badfil
 28088                                  	; 17/09/2023
 28089                                  endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 28090 00002009 C3                      	retn

 28093                                  ;
 28094                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 28095                                  ;
 28096                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands

 28101                                  multi_pass:
 28102 0000200A 0E                      	push	cs
 28103 0000200B 1F                      	pop	ds
 28104                                  
 28105 0000200C 803E[CD02]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 28106                                  ;jae_endconv:
 28107 00002011 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 28108                                  
 28109                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28110 00002013 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]
 28111                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28112                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 28113 00002017 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 28114                                  
 28115 00002018 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 28116 0000201C 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 28117 00002020 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 28118 00002022 8936[5A03]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 28119 00002026 8936[AF02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 28120                                  
 28121 0000202A E8DA21                  	call	getchr
 28122 0000202D EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 28123                                  
 28124                                  	; 17/09/2023
 28125                                  	; 01/01/2023
 28126                                  ;endconv:
 28127                                  	;retn	
 28128                                  
 28129                                  getcom:
 28130                                  	; 03/01/2023
 28131                                  	; ds = cs
 28132 0000202F E81216                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 28133 00002032 E8D221                  	call	getchr
 28134                                  conflp: 
 28135 00002035 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 28136                                  
 28137 00002037 FF06[AF02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 28138                                  
 28139                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28140 0000203B 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 28141                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 28142                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 28143 0000203D 8826[9B14]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 28144 00002041 8826[9E14]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 28145                                  
 28146 00002045 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 28147 00002047 7448                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 28148                                  
 28149                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28150                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 28151                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28152                                  ;%if 0
 28153                                  
 28154                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28155                                  
 28156                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 28157                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 28158                                  
 28159 00002049 A2[9914]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 28160                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 28161 0000204C 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 28162                                  
 28163                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28164 0000204E 3826[9A14]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 28165                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 28166 00002052 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 28167                                  
 28168 00002054 50                              push    ax                      ;
 28169 00002055 E8AF21                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 28170 00002058 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 28171 0000205A E8AA21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 28172 0000205D 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 28173 0000205F A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 28174 00002062 58                              pop     ax
 28175                                  ;
 28176                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 28177                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 28178                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 28179                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 28180                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 28181                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 28182                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 28183                                  ;   spot.
 28184                                  ;
 28185                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 28186                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 28187                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 28188                                  ;   retrieved.
 28189                                  ;
 28190 00002063 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 28191 00002068 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28192                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 28193 0000206A F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 28194 0000206F 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 28195 00002071 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 28196 00002076 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28197                                  final:                                  ;
 28198 00002078 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 28199                                  not_final:                              ;
 28200                                  ;endif
 28201                                  
 28202                                  ; 31/12/2022
 28203                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28204                                  
 28205 0000207B 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 28206 0000207D E88721                  	call	getchr
 28207 00002080 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 28208                                  
 28209 00002082 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 28210                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 28211                                  	; 27/10/2022
 28212 00002087 7380                    	jnb	short endconv	
 28213 00002089 E95408                  	jmp	badop
 28214                                  	
 28215                                  coff:	
 28216                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28217                                  	; ds = cs
 28218                                  	;push	cs
 28219                                  	;pop	ds
 28220 0000208C E86F21                  	call	newline
 28221 0000208F EBA4                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 28222                                  
 28223                                  blank_line:
 28224 00002091 E87321                  	call	getchr
 28225 00002094 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 28226                                  
 28227                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28228                                  ; 11/12/2022
 28229                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 28230                                  ;coff_p:
 28231                                  	;push	cs
 28232                                  	;pop	ds
 28233                                  
 28234                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 28235                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 28236                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 28237                                  ;install= command.
 28238                                  
 28239                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28240                                  ;install command
 28241                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28242                                  
 28243                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 28244                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 28245                                  tryi:
 28246 00002096 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 28247 0000209B 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 28248 0000209D E97F01                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 28249                                  not_init_pass:
 28250 000020A0 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 28251                                          ; 11/12/2022
 28252                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 28253 000020A5 74E5                    	je	short coff
 28254                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28255                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 28256                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 28257                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 28258                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 28259                                  					; and before install= commands
 28260                                  					; are processed
 28261                                  
 28262 000020A7 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 28263 000020AC 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 28264 000020AE 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 28265                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28266                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 28267 000020B1 74D9                    	je	short coff
 28268                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28269                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 28270                                  
 28271                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 28272                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 28273                                          
 28274 000020B3 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 28275                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28276 000020B6 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 28277                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28278                                  	;jne	short tryb	
 28279                                  	
 28280                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 28281 000020B8 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 28282                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 28283 000020BD EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 28284                                  
 28285                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28286                                  ; (SYSINIT:2448h)
 28287                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28288                                  ;%if 0
 28289                                  precheck_installhigh:
 28290 000020BF 80FC57                  	cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 28291 000020C2 756B                    	jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 28292                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 28293 000020C4 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 28294 000020C9 EBC1                    	jmp	short coff
 28295                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28296                                  
 28297                                  multi_try_i:
 28298 000020CB 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 28299                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 28300 000020CE 750A                    	jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 28301                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28302                                  	;jne	short multi_pass_filter
 28303                                  
 28304                                  ; 31/12/2022
 28305                                  ;%if 1 
 28306                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28307                                  ;%if 0
 28308                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28309 000020D0 E8A11F                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 28310 000020D3 7241                    	jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 28311                                  ;endif
 28312                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28313                                  
 28314 000020D5 E8DBEF                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 28315 000020D8 EBB2                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 28316                                  
 28317                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28318                                  ; (SYSINIT:2463h)
 28319                                  ;%if 1
 28320                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28321                                  ;%if 0
 28322                                  
 28323                                  multi_try_n:
 28324 000020DA 80FC57                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 28325 000020DD 7537                            jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 28326                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28327 000020DF E8921F                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd

 28389                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28390                                  ;									      *
 28391                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 28392                                  ;									      *
 28393                                  ; input :								      *
 28394                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 28395                                  ; output:								      *
 28396                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 28397                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 28398                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 28399                                  ;									      *
 28400                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 28401                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 28402                                  ; logic:								      *
 28403                                  ; {									      *
 28404                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 28405                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 28406                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 28407                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 28408                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 28409                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 28410                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 28411                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 28412                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 28413                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 28414                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 28415                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 28416                                  ;	};								      *
 28417                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 28418                                  ; };									      *
 28419                                  ;									      *

 28515                                  ;****************************************************************************
 28516                                  ;									    *
 28517                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 28518                                  ;									    *
 28519                                  ; input :								    *
 28520                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 28521                                  ; output:								    *
 28522                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 28523                                  ;									    *
 28524                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 28525                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *

 28533                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *

 28541                                  ; };									    *

 29183                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 29184                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 29185                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 29186                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 29187                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the

 30123                                  
 30124                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30125                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 30126                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 30127                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 30128                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 30129                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 30130                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 30131                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 30132                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30133                                  
 30134                                  ;**************************************************************************
 30135                                  ;									  *
 30136                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 30137                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 30138                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 30139                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 30140                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 30141                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 30142                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 30143                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 30144                                  ; input :								  *
 30145                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 30146                                  ; output:								  *
 30147                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 30148                                  ;									  *
 30149                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 30150                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 30151                                  ; logic:								  *
 30152                                  ; {									  *
 30153                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 30154                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 30155                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 30156                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 30157                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 30158                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 30159                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30160                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 30161                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30162                                  ;	     }								  *
 30163                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 30164                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 30165                                  ;	};								  *
 30166                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 30167                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 30168                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 30169                                  ; };									  *
 30170                                  ;**************************************************************************
 30171                                  
 30172                                  tryk:
 30173                                          ;if      stacksw
 30174

 30919                                  
 30920                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30921                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 30922                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 30923                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 30924                                  ;
 30925                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30926                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30927                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30928                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30929                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30930                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30931                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30932                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30933                                  ;	 procedure.
 30934                                  ;	ax - exit code
 30935                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 30936                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 30937                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 30938                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 30939                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31282                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31283                                  ;
 31284                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 31285                                  ;
 31286                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 31287                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 31288                                  ;
 31289                                  ;	Output : none
 31290                                  ;
 31291                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 31292                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 31293                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31294                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 31295                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31296                                  ;
 31297                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31300                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31301                                  	; ds = cs
 31302 00002966 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]

 31304                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 31305 00002969 E84200                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 31306 0000296C 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 31307                                  	; 13/05/2019
 31308                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 31309                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 31310                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 31311                                  	; 11/12/2022

 31314 00002973 74F0                    	je	short limx
 31315 00002975 A1[3E1F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 31316                                  lim_set:
 31317                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31318                                  	; 11/12/2022

 31326                                  ;
 31327                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 31328                                  ;
 31329                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 31330                                  ;	Output : none
 31331                                  ;
 31332                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 31333                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 31334                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 31335                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 31336                                  ;
 31337                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31338                                  
 31339                                  	; 01/11/2022
 31340                                  SetInt12Mem:
 31341 00002978 1E                      	push	ds
 31342 00002979 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 31343 0000297C 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 31344 0000297E 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 31345                                  	;mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 31346 00002982 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 31347 00002984 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 31348 00002986 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 31349                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 31350 00002989 1F                      	pop	ds
 31351                                  	; 14/04/2024
 31352                                  	; ds = cs
 31353 0000298A 891E[5C1F]              	mov	[OldInt12Mem],bx
 31354 0000298E C606[5B1F]FF            	mov	byte [Int12Lied],0FFh
 31355                                  ;limx:
 31356 00002993 C3                      	retn
 31357                                  
 31358                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31359                                  ;
 31360                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 31361                                  ;
 31362                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 31363                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 31364                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 31365                                  ;

 31367                                  ;

 31369                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 31370                                  ;
 31371                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31379                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway

 31381                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31382 0000299B B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 31383 0000299E 8826[5B1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 31384                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 31385                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 31386 000029A2 1E                      	push	ds
 31387                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 31388 000029A3 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 31389 000029A5 2EA1[5C1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]

 31391 000029AC 1F                      	pop	ds
 31392                                  timx:
 31393 000029AD C3                      	retn
