 31443                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31444                                  ;%if 0
 31445                                  
 31446                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31447                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31448                                  
 31449                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 31450                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 31451                                  
 31452                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31453                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 31454                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31455                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31456                                  
 31457                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31458                                  ;
 31459                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 31460                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 31461                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 31462                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 31463                                  ;
 31464                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 31465                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 31466                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 31467                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 31468                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 31469                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 31470                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 31471                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 31472                                  ; available during the load.
 31473                                  ;
 31474                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 31475                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 31476                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 31477                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 31478                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 31479                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 31480                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 31481                                  ;
 31482                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 31483                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 31484                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 31485                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 31486                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 31487                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 31488                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 31489                                  ;
 31490                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31491                                  
 31492                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 31493                                  
 31494                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 31495                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 31496                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 31497                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 31498                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 31499                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 31500                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 31501                                  
 31502                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 31503                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 31504                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 31505                                  
 31506                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31507                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 31508                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31509                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 31510                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 31511                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 31512                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31513                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31514                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 31515                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 31516                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31517                                  
 31518                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31519                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31520                                  
 31521                                  InitVar:
 31522                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31523                                  	; ds = cs
 31524                                  
 31525                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 31526                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31527                                  	;push	ax
 31528                                  	;push	cx
 31529                                  	;push	di
 31530 000029D8 06                      	push	es
 31531                                  
 31532                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 31533 000029D9 0E                      	push	cs
 31534 000029DA 07                      	pop	es
 31535                                  
 31536 000029DB 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31537                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31538                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31539                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31540                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31541                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31542                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 31543                                  
 31544                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31545                                  	; ds = cs
 31546 000029DD A2[031F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31547 000029E0 A2[021F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31548 000029E3 A3[041F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31549 000029E6 C606[061F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31550                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31551 000029EB A2[391F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 31552                                  
 31553 000029EE FC                      	cld
 31554                                  
 31555 000029EF B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 31556 000029F2 BF[071F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 31557 000029F5 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 31558                                  
 31559                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 31560                                  	; 01/01/2033
 31561 000029F7 B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 31562 000029F9 BF[171F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 31563 000029FC F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 31564                                  
 31565                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 31566                                  
 31567                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 31568 000029FE 07                      	pop	es
 31569                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31570                                  	;pop	di
 31571                                  	;pop	cx
 31572                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 31573                                  
 31574 000029FF C3                      	retn
 31575                                  
 31576                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31577                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 31578                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31579                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 31580                                  ; EXIT    : None
 31581                                  ; ERROR   : None
 31582                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31583                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31584                                  
 31585                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31586                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 31587                                  FixMem:
 31588                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31589                                  	;push	ax
 31590                                  	;push	bx
 31591                                  	;push	cx
 31592                                  	;push	dx
 31593 00002A00 06                      	push	es
 31594                                  
 31595 00002A01 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 31596                                  
 31597 00002A04 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 31598 00002A07 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 31599                                  
 31600 00002A09 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 31601                                  
 31602                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 31603                                  
 31604 00002A0B 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 31605 00002A0D 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 31606 00002A0F 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 31607                                  
 31608                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31609                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 31610                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 31611                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31612                                  
 31613 00002A10 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 31614 00002A14 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 31615 00002A19 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 31616 00002A1B 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 31617                                  
 31618                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 31619                                  
 31620 00002A1D 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 31621 00002A22 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 31622 00002A24 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 31623                                  
 31624 00002A28 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 31625                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 31626                                  	; 11/07/2023
 31627 00002A2D 43                      	inc	bx
 31628 00002A2E 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 31629                                  
 31630                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 31631                                  
 31632 00002A33 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 31633 00002A35 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 31634                                  
 31635 00002A3A 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 31636 00002A3C 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31637 00002A41 43                      	inc	bx
 31638 00002A42 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 31639                                  
 31640                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 31641 00002A44 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 31642 00002A46 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 31643                                  fmX:	
 31644 00002A48 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 31645                                  
 31646 00002A4B 07                      	pop	es
 31647                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31648                                  	;pop	dx
 31649                                  	;pop	cx
 31650                                  	;pop	bx
 31651                                  	;pop	ax
 31652                                  
 31653 00002A4C C3                      	retn
 31654                                  
 31655                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31656                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 31657                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31658                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 31659                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 31660                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31661                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 31662                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31663                                  
 31664                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31665                                  fm_link:
 31666 00002A4D B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 31667 00002A50 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 31668                                  
 31669                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 31670                                  	;
 31671                                  	;push	es
 31672                                  	;push	cs
 31673                                  	;pop	es
 31674                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 31675                                  	;pop	es
 31676                                  	
 31677                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31678                                  	; ds = cs
 31679                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 31680 00002A52 A2[371F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 31681                                  
 31682 00002A55 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31683 00002A58 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 31684 00002A5B CD21                    	int	21h
 31685 00002A5D C3                      	retn
 31686                                  
 31687                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31688                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 31689                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31690                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 31691                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31692                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31693                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 31694                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31695                                  
 31696                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31697                                  fm_unlink:
 31698 00002A5E 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31699                                  	
 31700                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 31701                                  	;
 31702                                  	;push	ds
 31703                                  	;push	cs
 31704                                  	;pop	ds
 31705                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 31706                                  	;pop	ds
 31707                                  	
 31708                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31709                                  	; ds = cs
 31710                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 31711 00002A60 8A1E[371F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 31712                                  
 31713 00002A64 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31714 00002A67 CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 31715 00002A69 C3                      	retn
 31716                                  
 31717                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31718                                  
 31719                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31720                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 31721                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 31722                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31723                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 31724                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 31725                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 31726                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31727                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31728                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 31729                                  ;
 31730                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 31731                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 31732                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31733                                  ;
 31734                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 31735                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 31736                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 31737                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 31738                                  ;
 31739                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 31740                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 31741                                  ;
 31742                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31743                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 31744                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 31745                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 31746                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 31747                                  ;     lh
 31748                                  ;     /l
 31749                                  ;     1
 31750                                  ;     1000
 31751                                  ;     2
 31752                                  ;     print
 31753                                  ;     /d
 31754                                  ;     :lpt2
 31755                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31756                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31757                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31758                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31759                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31760                                  ; for:
 31761                                  ;    Each /L
 31762                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31763                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31764                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31765                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31766                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31767                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31768                                  
 31769                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31770                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31771                                  
 31772                                  ParseVar:
 31773                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31774                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31775                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31776 00002A6A 1E                      	push	ds
 31777 00002A6B 06                      	push	es
 31778                                  
 31779 00002A6C 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31780 00002A6D 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31781 00002A6E FC                      	cld
 31782                                  
 31783                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31784                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31785                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31786                                  
 31787 00002A6F AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31788 00002A70 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31789 00002A73 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31790                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31791 00002A75 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31792 00002A77 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31793                                  
 31794 00002A79 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31795 00002A7A F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31796 00002A7B EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31797                                  
 31798 00002A7D AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31799                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31800 00002A7E 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31801                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31802 00002A80 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31803 00002A82 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31804                                  
 31805                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31806 00002A84 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31807                                  
 31808                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31809                                  	;
 31810                                  	;push	es
 31811                                  	;push	cs
 31812                                  	;pop	es
 31813                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31814                                  	;pop	es
 31815                                  
 31816 00002A89 2EC606[031F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31817                                  
 31818 00002A8F EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31819                                  
 31820                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31821 00002A91 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 31822 00002A93 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 31823                                  
 31824                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31825 00002A95 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31826                                  
 31827 00002A9A E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31828 00002A9D 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31829                                  
 31830 00002A9F 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31831 00002AA0 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31832                                  
 31833                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31834 00002AA2 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31835 00002AA5 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31836 00002AA6 4E                      	dec	si
 31837 00002AA7 F9                      	stc
 31838                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31839 00002AA8 07                      	pop	es
 31840 00002AA9 1F                      	pop	ds
 31841                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31842                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31843 00002AAA C3                      	retn
 31844                                  
 31845                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31846                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31847                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31848                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31849                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31850                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31851                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31852                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31853                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31854                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31855                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 31856                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31857                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31858                                  
 31859                                  parseL:
 31860 00002AAB AC                      	lodsb
 31861 00002AAC 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31862 00002AAE 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31863                                  
 31864                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31865                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31866                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31867                                  
 31868 00002AB0 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31869 00002AB3 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31870 00002AB5 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31871                                  
 31872 00002AB8 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31873 00002ABA E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31874 00002ABD 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31875                                  
 31876                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31877 00002ABF 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31878                                  
 31879 00002AC4 AC                      	lodsb
 31880 00002AC5 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31881 00002AC7 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31882                                  
 31883 00002AC9 E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31884 00002ACC 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31885                                  
 31886 00002ACE E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31887 00002AD1 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31888                                  
 31889                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31890 00002AD3 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31891 00002AD5 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31892                                  
 31893 00002AD7 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31894 00002AD9 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31895                                  
 31896                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31897                                  
 31898 00002ADB E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31899 00002ADE 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31900                                  
 31901 00002AE0 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31902                                  
 31903 00002AE3 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31904                                  
 31905                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31906 00002AE6 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31907                                  
 31908 00002AEB AC                      	lodsb
 31909 00002AEC 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31910 00002AEE 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31911                                  
 31912 00002AF0 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31913 00002AF3 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31914                                  
 31915 00002AF5 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31916 00002AF8 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31917                                  
 31918                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31919 00002AFA 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31920 00002AFC 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31921                                  plE1:	
 31922                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31923 00002AFE B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31924 00002B01 4E                      	dec	si
 31925 00002B02 F9                      	stc
 31926 00002B03 C3                      	retn
 31927                                  
 31928                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 31929 00002B04 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 31930                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31931                                  	; cf=1
 31932                                  	;stc
 31933 00002B07 C3                      	retn
 31934                                  plSwX:	
 31935 00002B08 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 31936                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 31937                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 31938                                  	; cf=0
 31939                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 31940 00002B09 C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.

 31967                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31968                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31969                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31970                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31971                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31972                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31973                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31974                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31975                                  
 31976                                  isEOL:
 31977 00002B0A 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 31978 00002B0C 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31979 00002B0E 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31980 00002B10 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31981 00002B12 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31982                                  ieX:	
 31983 00002B14 C3                      	retn
 31984                                  
 31985                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31986                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 31987                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31988                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31989                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31990                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31991                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31992                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31993                                  
 31994                                  isWhite:
 31995 00002B15 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 31996 00002B17 7406                    	je	short iwX
 31997 00002B19 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 31998 00002B1B 7402                    	je	short iwX
 31999 00002B1D 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 32000                                  iwX:	
 32001 00002B1F C3                      	retn

 32054                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32055                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 32056                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 32057                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 32058                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 32059                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32060                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 32061                                  ; EXIT:     None
 32062                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 32063                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 32064                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32065                                  
 32066                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32067                                  stowUMB:
 32068 00002B33 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 32069 00002B35 7202                    	jb	short su10
 32070 00002B37 F9                      	stc
 32071 00002B38 C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 32072                                  su10:	
 32073                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32074                                  	;push	bx
 32075                                  	;push	di
 32076                                  	;push	si
 32077                                  	;push	ds
 32078                                  	;push	es
 32079                                  	;push	cs
 32080                                  	;pop	es
 32081                                  	;push	cs
 32082                                  	;pop	ds
 32083                                  
 32084                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32085                                  	; ds <> cs
 32086                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 32087 00002B39 2E803E[061F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 32088                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 32089 00002B3F 7504                    	jne	short su20
 32090 00002B41 2EA2[061F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 32091

 32093                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 32094                                  	;jne	short su20

 32096                                  su20:

 32098 00002B47 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.

 32167                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32168                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 32169                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 32170                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 32171                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 32172                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32173                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 32174                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 32175                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 32176                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 32177                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32178                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 32179                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 32180                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 32181                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32182                                  
 32183                                  gnradix:
 32184 00002B58 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 32185                                  
 32186                                  toDigit:
 32187 00002B5A 2E833E[582B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 32188 00002B60 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 32189                                  
 32190                                  toDigit_hex:
 32191 00002B62 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 32192 00002B65 7209                    	jb	short td10
 32193 00002B67 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 32194 00002B6A 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 32195 00002B6C 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 32196                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32197 00002B6F C3                      	retn
 32198                                  td10:	
 32199 00002B70 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 32200 00002B73 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 32201 00002B75 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 32202 00002B78 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 32203 00002B7A 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 32204                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32205 00002B7D C3                      	retn
 32206                                  toDigit_dec:
 32207                                  td20:	
 32208 00002B7E 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 32209                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 32210 00002B81 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 32211 00002B83 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 32212 00002B86 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 32213 00002B88 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 32214                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32215 00002B8B C3                      	retn
 32216                                  tdE:	
 32217 00002B8C F9                      	stc
 32218                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 32219 00002B8D C3                      	retn
 32220                                  
 32221                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32222                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 32223                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32224                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 32225                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 32226                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 32227                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 32228                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32229                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 32230                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 32231                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 32232                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32233                                  
 32234                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32235                                  
 32236                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32237                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 32238                                  
 32239                                  GetXNum:
 32240                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 32241                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32242                                  	;push	bx
 32243 00002B8E 51                      	push	cx ; *
 32244                                  	;push	ds
 32245                                  
 32246 00002B8F FC                      	cld
 32247 00002B90 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 32248 00002B92 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 32249 00002B94 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 32250 00002B96 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 32251                                  
 32252 00002B98 2EC706[582B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 32253                                  
 32254 00002B9F 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 32255                                  	;call	toDigit
 32256 00002BA2 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 32257                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 32258                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32259 00002BA5 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 32260                                  
 32261 00002BA7 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 32262 00002BA9 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 32263 00002BAB 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 32264 00002BAF 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 32265 00002BB2 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 32266 00002BB4 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 32267 00002BB7 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 32268                                  
 32269                                  gxn10:	
 32270 00002BB9 2EC706[582B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 32271 00002BC0 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 32272 00002BC1 46                      	inc	si
 32273                                  
 32274                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 32275                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 32276                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 32277                                  ;        BX    = 0
 32278                                  ;        CH    = 0
 32279                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 32280                                  
 32281                                  gxn20:	
 32282 00002BC2 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 32283 00002BC5 46                      	inc	si
 32284                                  
 32285 00002BC6 E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 32286 00002BC9 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 32287                                  
 32288 00002BCB E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 32289 00002BCE 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 32290                                  
 32291 00002BD0 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 32292 00002BD2 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 32293                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 32294                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 32295 00002BD4 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 32296                                  gxnE:	
 32297                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 32298 00002BD6 EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 32299                                  gxnQ:	
 32300 00002BD8 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 32301 00002BD9 F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 32302                                  gxnX:	
 32303                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32304                                  	;pop	ds
 32305 00002BDA 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 32306                                  	;pop	bx
 32307 00002BDB C3                      	retn
 32308                                  
 32309                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32310                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 32311                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32312                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 32313                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 32314                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 32315                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 32316                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32317                                  
 32318                                  mul32:
 32319 00002BDC 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32320 00002BDD 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32321 00002BDF 2EF726[582B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32322 00002BE4 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 32323                                  
 32324 00002BE6 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32325 00002BE8 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 32326                                  
 32327 00002BE9 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 32328 00002BEB 2EF726[582B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 32329 00002BF0 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 32330 00002BF2 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 32331 00002BF4 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 32332 00002BF6 C3                      	retn
 32333                                  m32E:	
 32334 00002BF7 58                      	pop	ax
 32335 00002BF8 C3                      	retn
 32336                                  
 32337                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32338                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 32339                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32340                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 32341                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 32342                                  ; ERROR:   None
 32343                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 32344                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32345                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 32346                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 32347                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32348                                  
 32349                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32350                                  toPara:
 32351 00002BF9 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 32352                                  
 32353 00002BFA B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 32354 00002BFC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 32355 00002BFE 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 32356 00002BFF B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 32357 00002C01 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 32358 00002C03 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 32359                                  
 32360 00002C05 59                      	pop	cx
 32361 00002C06 C3                      	retn
 32362                                  
 32363                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32364                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 32365                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32366                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 32367                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 32368                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 32369                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32370                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32371                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 32372                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 32373                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 32374                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 32375                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32376                                  
 32377                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32378                                  UmbHead:
 32379                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 32380                                  
 32381                                  	;push	si ; ?
 32382                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 32383                                  	;push	es
 32384                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 32385                                  
 32386                                  	; 09/04/2019
 32387                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 32388                                  
 32389 00002C07 B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 32390 00002C09 CD21                    	int	21h
 32391                                  
 32392 00002C0B 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 32393                                  	
 32394                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32395 00002C0F 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32396 00002C12 F5                      	cmc
 32397                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 32398 00002C13 C3                      	retn
 32399                                  
 32400                                  ; 01/01/2023
 32401                                  ;%if 0
 32402                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32403                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 32404                                  ;
 32405                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 32406                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 32407                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 32408                                  ;	retn
 32409                                  ;uhE:	
 32410                                  ;	stc
 32411                                  ;uhX:	
 32412                                  ;	;pop	bx ; *
 32413                                  ;	;pop	es
 32414                                  ;	;pop	ds ; ?
 32415                                  ;	;pop	si ; ?
 32416                                  ;	retn
 32417                                  ;%endif
 32418                                  
 32419                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32420                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 32421                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32422                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 32423                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 32424                                  ; USES:   Flags
 32425                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32426                                  
 32427                                  isSysMCB:
 32428                                  	;push	ax
 32429                                  
 32430                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 32431                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 32432                                  	;je	short ism10
 32433                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 32434                                  	;;je	short ism10
 32435                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 32436                                  	;jne	short ismX
 32437 00002C14 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 32438 00002C1A 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 32439                                  ism10:	
 32440                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 32441                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 32442 00002C1C 26813E08005343          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 32443                                  ismX:	
 32444                                  	;pop	ax
 32445 00002C23 C3                      	retn
 32446                                  
 32447                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32448                                  
 32449                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32450                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 32451                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32452                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 32453                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 32454                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 32455                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32456                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32457                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 32458                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 32459                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 32460                                  ;      ...
 32461                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 32462                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32463                                  
 32464                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32465                                  AddrToUmb:
 32466                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32467                                  	;push	cx
 32468                                  	;push	dx
 32469 00002C24 06                      	push	es
 32470                                  
 32471 00002C25 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 32472                                  
 32473 00002C27 E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 32474 00002C2A 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 32475                                  
 32476                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32477                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 32478 00002C2C 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 32479                                  
 32480                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32481                                  atu10:
 32482 00002C2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 32483                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 32484                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 32485                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 32486                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 32487                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 32488                                  
 32489                                  ;atu10:	
 32490                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 32491 00002C30 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 32492 00002C32 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 32493                                  
 32494 00002C34 E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 32495 00002C37 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 32496                                  
 32497 00002C39 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 32498                                  atu20:	
 32499                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32500                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 32501                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32502                                  	; ax = es
 32503                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32504 00002C3A 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32505 00002C3F 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 32506 00002C45 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 32507                                  
 32508                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 32509                                  
 32510                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32511                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 32512                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32513 00002C47 40                      	inc	ax
 32514                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32515                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 32516 00002C48 EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 32517                                  
 32518                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32519                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 32520                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 32521                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32522                                  
 32523                                  atu30:	
 32524                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32525                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 32526                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32527                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 32528 00002C4A 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 32529 00002C4C 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 32530                                  atuE:	
 32531 00002C4E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 32532 00002C50 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 32533                                  atuX:	
 32534 00002C51 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 32535                                  	
 32536 00002C53 07                      	pop	es	
 32537                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32538                                  	;pop	dx
 32539                                  	;pop	cx
 32540 00002C54 C3                      	retn
 32541                                  
 32542                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32543                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 32544                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 32545                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 32546                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 32547                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32548                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 32549                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 32550                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32551                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32552                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32553                                  
 32554                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32555                                  convUMB:
 32556 00002C55 2E833E[582B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 32557 00002C5B 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 32558 00002C5D E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 32559                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32560                                  	;jne	short cu10
 32561                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 32562                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32563 00002C60 40                      	inc	ax
 32564 00002C61 7401                    	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 32565 00002C63 48                      	dec	ax
 32566                                  cu10:	
 32567 00002C64 C3                      	retn
 32568                                  
 32569                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32570                                  ;%if 0
 32571                                  ;
 32572                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32573                                  ;;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 32574                                  ;;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 32575                                  ;; of the usual HIGH_FIRST. See the code.
 32576                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32594                                  ; loadLow subroutine is not used anywhere of IO.SYS 6.22 (& 5.0)
 32595                                  %if 0
 32596                                  
 32597                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32598                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 32599                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32600                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 32601                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 32602                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 32603                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32604                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 32605                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32606                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 32607                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0. That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 32608                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 32609                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 32610                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32611                                  
 32612                                  loadLow:

 32614                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 32615                                  	;pop	ds

 32617                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 32618                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 32619                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 32620                                  	jne	short ll10
 32621                                  
 32622                                  	stc
 32623                                  ll15:
 32624                                  	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 32625                                  	;stc
 32626                                  	;jmp	short llX
 32627                                  	retn
 32628                                  ll10:	
 32629                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 32630                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 32631                                  
 32632                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32633                                  	retn
 32634                                  
 32635                                  	;mov	al,1
 32636                                  	;clc
 32637                                  ;llX:
 32638                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 32639                                  	;retn
 32640                                  
 32641                                  %endif

 32643                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32644                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 32645                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32646                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 32647                                  ; EXIT:   None
 32648                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32649                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 32650                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32651                                  
 32652                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 32676 00002C71 C606[021F]01            	mov	byte [fInHigh],1
 32677                                  
 32678                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 32679                                  	;mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32680                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32681 00002C76 A0[061F]                	mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 32682                                  
 32683 00002C79 3CFF                    	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED	; If they didn't,
 32684 00002C7B 7420                    	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 32685                                  
 32686 00002C7D 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 32687                                  
 32688                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
